section.title: Unreal past
section.sectiontitle: We use wish/if only to describe unreal or imaginary situations. These are often regrets. Wish/If only + past tenses describe imaginary present or future.
section.sectiontitle2: Wish/If only + Past Perfect describes the imaginary past.

section.title: Unreal past
section.sectiontitle: Wish + object + would is used to complain about something.
section.text1a: I wish they would stop playing loud music at night.
section.text2a: She wishes you would take her somewhere nice for a change.
section.sectiontitle2: We use it's time/it's high time/it's about time + past tenses to say something should be happening now, but isn't.

section.title: Unreal past
section.sectiontitle: We use would rather/would sooner + Past Simple to describe preferences.
section.sectiontitle2: If the person who expresses the preference and the subject are the same, we use would rather/would sooner + infinitive without to.

section.title: Unreal past
section.sectiontitle: We use what if/supposing/suppose + past tenses to ask about an imaginary situation in the present or future.
section.text2a: Supposing she asked you nicely to help her?
section.sectiontitle2: We use what if/supposing/suppose + Past Perfect to ask about an imaginary situation in the past.

section.title: Unreal past
section.sectiontitle: We use what if/supposing/suppose + Present Simple to ask about a situation that we think is probable.
section.text1a: What if you go to the boss and ask for a better deal?
section.text2a: Supposing she's the perfect woman for you?
